title: The Ice Bucket Challenge — Earned Media at Scale
summary: The ALS Ice Bucket Challenge became the most successful viral PR campaign in history, raising $115 million for ALS research in eight weeks through peer-to-peer social media activation.
background: The ALS Association was a small charity with limited budget and awareness. The Ice Bucket Challenge began spontaneously before the Association embraced and amplified it.
response: The Association monitored the trend, quickly created content frameworks, engaged celebrity participants, and provided clear calls to action — while allowing organic sharing to drive momentum.
outcome: $115 million raised, 17 million videos created, 440 million people engaged, and a 3,500% increase in donations — all within eight weeks.
lessons: Authentic peer-to-peer sharing outperforms brand-led content
Removing barriers to participation drives virality
Speed of response to organic trends is critical
A clear call to action channels enthusiasm into results
discussion_questions: What made the Challenge so uniquely shareable?
Could this success be replicated intentionally?
